snippet: Israel’s president and prime minister have declined requests for meetings with former President Jimmy Carter, who has long been a harsh critic of Israel’s policy toward the Palestinians.
abstract: Israeli Pres Reuven Rivlin and Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu decline to meet with former United States Pres Jimmy Carter, harsh critic of Israel’s policy toward Palestinians and author of 2006 book Palestine: Peace Not Apartheid.
lead_paragraph: Israel’s president and prime minister have declined requests for meetings with former President Jimmy Carter, who has long been a harsh critic of Israel’s policy toward the Palestinians.

headline.main: Israel: Leaders Decline to Meet Carter
headline.print_headline: Middle East; Israel: Leaders Decline to Meet Carter
